comment.body:
I'm also looking for such license, i don't think unlicensed prevents proprietary non-sharealike derivatives, and cc.4-0 allows compatibility (basically re-license under another license).
people run away from GPLvx. afaik v3 is not compatible with anything (but older (L)GPLvx may be compatible with it, along with some others). 

the FSF recommends cc0 over unlicensed even though they don't recommend cc0 for software, sigh!

a lot of people use GPLv2 for its permissiveness, btw.
>[from] GPL (...) I know about some of the loopholes in a few versions.

i would like to hear about it if you have time :D
@Styromaniac: i see, however tivoization can still be subjective, many emulators use v2 for the sake of it, or in spite of something in v3, idk :S

i wouldn't add that last sentence until being 110% sure that you fully understand all of the implications.

the intentions are clearly stated. when you properly format it into clause/sections it may be easier to find problems and refine it.

edit: not that any specific formatting is necessary.
@Styromaniac: the idea is great, but it may take time to perfect it :)

> If that's not your point, and it's about other possibilities

yeah that's what i meant.
@Styromaniac: nice, well i'll keep checking out for sure. hopefully more users scrutiny and your future efforts will tighten your license.
@Styromaniac: huh, that could be tricky, what if the app for conversion is unavailable for whatever reason?

"and will never be distributed for financial"
"and shall not be distributed for financial"
i think 'will' implies your will about it.
 
4 is more of an advice, subsequently 4a, what does the youtube license says about such things? or vimeo? these sort of infringements happen all the time there.
 
"This license is permanent unless
a court case says this license if flawed"
that's just a liability for you, not very useful.
 
about that last one, are you sure you will never want to sue?
i don't even know if you have the right to legally bound yourself
to 'not sue' under any circumstance, unless it involves a third party agreement.

You should also mention something like this: "and the cool thing about it is that everyone is connected, everyone can see everyone, and you can block anyone or anything that bothers you" otherwise they may have a shocking surprise every once in a while.
@Styromaniac: sheesh, i'm a shitty coder who barely knows web stuff. don't even know where to begin, how would i go about inserting a Emscripten app?
just claim it and change it?
@Styromaniac: any change?

@Styromaniac: so it worked, c'mmon man just [watch it](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TcqWok8AubE)
**strong language warning**
@Styromaniac: R.i.p Terry A. David!

is there a way to run a procedure when publishing? if that is possible then we would be able to insert hotlinks (on the main page) to previous versions on the headers (e.g: username-latest), and something similar to the css (don't understand how css name lookup works).

sure we can do it manually, just add a new hotlink and edit your own HTML file, but it would be nice to streamline the whole thing so every time someone adds something, it backup the previous changes.

the js code doesn't really matter right? you are either improving older stuff, slight modifying or just adding new stuff, right?
@Thunder33345: +1, tutorial for newbies would be cool, i just started using 0Net a couple of weeks ago, i think a lot of people (including me) would like to watch this kind of content.
@Styromaniac: lol, i mean 0Net is very inclusive, all distributed networks are i guess.
@Styromaniac: haha, how long you've been here? in fact in those few weeks I've only seen people in this thread (and a few others) actively posting.
@Styromaniac: lol, i wasted a lot of time on shitty forums and rather content shallow networks (diaspora). did a lot of things changed since then?
@Eightyfour: yeah me too, he was eccentric, racist, but likable.

@Styromaniac: tbh its also because zeronet is not that well known imo, I've been using peertube, diaspora, mastodon, you know 'everything alternative' to mainstream stuff and just heard of zeronet recently, even if a sudden surge of quality user content were to take place here idk how would that make a big impact in 0Net popularity. but then again, i don't know shit about zeronet history.
@Eightyfour: those are gold, strong figurative speech for special occasions though. i hope someone can continue to support TempleOS in his memory.
@Styromaniac: well, maybe that's for the better. even these 'special people' need a place to be themselves. 4chan won't last forever the way things are going.

@Eightyfour: Click on 'Categories', select a category and click to subscribe.

edit: you don't need to subscribe, just click to download them.

kinda like magnet links?

@Styromaniac: oh, i thought it was some sort of euphemism :D

what is tandem?

also worth mentioning that it is much more than a fb clone, for instance you can advertise and sell things and services.

edit: i know that facebook can do that but Connect is more transparent, like ebay.
probably worse than being ugly, people will have more expectations i guess.
@Styromaniac: +1

damn, steemit looks like some sort of Orwellian nightmare.

@Styromaniac: huh, i can work with that, though i would drag the conversation along waiting for an idea, how would you follow that :D?

@Styromaniac: that's kind of sympathetic, i would go for creepier or troublesome (more than it already is).

is there any other way? "X" follows "Y" specification is code for "there is going to be many surprises :3"

is there subjectivity in such a thing? are we really trying to justify what he did?
@nekololi: i meant the same thing, the act itself isn't justifiable, as you inferred. this is really detrimental to 0Net tbh.
@nekololi: i understand, maybe i'm just acting out. should we have a system to report JUST that kind of stuff?

@nekololi: i what i mean by reporting is, like you said:
> owner of his hub in an awkward position where they might have to go in and delete his post.
@nekololi: i see, thanks for the info.
@nekololi: so the hub owner doesn't even get any blame. that's actually pretty smart lol

you commie, they don't get wealthy because they lack free market...
i don't quite see how this undermines racist ideology, but ok.
@Agentorange: so you are saying that you are 100% snow nigga?
@Styromaniac: ~~i don't think it does, if anything it strengthen them. is rationality the force that creates racism? "you go high, we go low".~~ forget it, i was conflating terms, my mistake.
honestly, I'm pro any kind of shaming if you are being objective. it is something being done, doing something is always better than doing nothing. you can learn from it.

i was a ~~bad~~ designer a long time ago in a galaxy... you get the point.
I've always wanted to 'shoot from the hip' so i dived deep into the technicalities of these tool (photoshop, flash, gimp, etc) but in the end they are just tools, one of the things that carried me through when designing was to follow Miyagi's [advice](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jBhKKI3h52Y)

maybe its something like [this](https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/glue/201212/why-too-much-data-disables-your-decision-making), i heard a story about a guy who've gone living offgrid to learn assembly programming lol, i don't know if that's true or not.
lol, it reminds me of the sexual harassment panda.

@Styromaniac: i see, maybe that's the best approach, i discuss politics and philosophy a lot and amid discussion i feel sidetracked either by my bias or my intellect, so i take my time, try to assume my mistakes and read some more on the subject. easier said than done though.

but i agree, the originals should be preserved. the real problems with remakes is that they don't offer the original experience, REmake on pc kinda ruins the original atmosphere, there is no reason not to present both remaster and original versions. there's also the new voice acting on some games (silent hill hd collection), sometimes for somehow understandable reasons, but it sucks.

i think i feared (still do i guess) - being one person, like one personality - to be accepted in one group but not in others no matter how different these other groups are. its silly but i would like to get the most out of everything, to experience different things as much as possible.

so i don't even know half of the time if i'm lying to myself or if its common behavior for me to just change traits of my personality based on a particular situation. i don't even know what to make out of that.
@Styromaniac: probably unhealthy, but can you ignore that looming feeling of wanting more (something like that) ? idk about you but i know that i've surrendered to it every single time.
@Styromaniac: oh well, i think a lot of people do too. but everything is so plentiful, there is a lot to enjoy i guess.

what is interesting is that we have to code games with high latency in mind, some gameplay elements may have to be tweaked like overall speed, reward, etc.
maybe because you use your phone for more than just playing and joysticks just for playing... honestly i'm impressed on how fast and efficiently people can use smartphones.

@Styromaniac: Jesus, well almost everyone got lucky out of a bad idea at some point...

plus from what i gather such an ethno-state would be a total sausage party, not cool.

edit: you know, given that the vast majority of them are just dudes...

@Styromaniac: i think they are mostly moved by hate and hate by itself "justifies" lots of things. 

for instance i don't care much about anarchists, I've repeated that the overthrow of them from revolutionary Catalonia was well deserved, and that is because i disagree with them, imagine if i actually hated them, which i... anyways, its hate, which can alleviate confusion and reaffirm your convictions when its socially uncomfortable to perhaps rethink your position.

@Styromaniac: yup, i still do that sometimes... what stopped me (partially) from doing that was to realize that i was only hurting myself and making myself dumber by responding to emotions without any consideration for the truth about something.

better yet, do that for decentralisation in general since it has become a popular term, then you can mix anything with it (and bitcoin) to use them to drag zeronet along (and other dapps), at least that's my take, to use what is already popular and to associate with it.

@Styromaniac:~~ i agree but i was referring to selling an idea rather than an app image in itself, like when people buy a t-shirt because they like somehow what it stands for either in a picture or written form, like a band, a phrase or a picture.~~

@Styromaniac:
>would you be more likely to buy that instead of directly donating since you get something out of it?

your target here is zeronet users, for the sake of maintaining development, right? 

if for instance LBRY gives me merch for donating and assuming i would like to support LBRY, then i really don't care about the merch itself, but about LBRY.

to some degree i would want something that stands for something that i care, which doesn't necessarily mean i want merch with a zeronet logo but merch that stands for something that zeronet stands for.

for instance if i donated and got to choose a merch either representing zeronet only or decentralization i would prefer the latter.
@Styromaniac: no idea lol, but yeah some text or anything like any other merch about any other cause like charity or coffee mugs, lol i'm not very creative.

i must disagree, something is off about his fur, his skin color including his belly appearance (too dull), his facial expressions... also its design seems to be a compromised between modern and classic sonic which isn't exactly all that appealing, either be it the cute little chubby fur ball or the fuzzy skinny one... as it stands it just doesn't... pop.

besides design the animation is rather poor, pause on some action frames, sonic looks more like a fur costume than an actual character.
@Styromaniac: nah to mobius instead to show how earthlings are depicting their fellow countryman.

@Styromaniac: yeah i thought about that, even took the time to review his best 3d models (generations, forces, colors) and you are right, maybe it wouldn't work in a movie but i maintain that the fur and his skin color is off. but i think that ship has sailed. another point however is the presentation of his look, the animation work needs more of that pixar/disney squash and stretch to look more lively imo.
@Styromaniac: i meant his body, mostly on more casual scenes, it looks a little "stiff" and "costume" like.

@Styromaniac: one special case is at [1:58](https://youtu.be/KbSEnqQbWAg?t=118), its just bad posing, secondary animation, proportion, arcs, its rather rough, using this terminology is rather obnoxious but that is what i see...
@Styromaniac: it must be a matter of preference then...

@Styromaniac: oh yeah forgot about that movie... it was a short take on sonic but look at his facial expression, great secondary animation, also while sonic talks his whole body has secondary animation and beautiful arcs (smooth circular movement) on every single pose. just because its disney it doesn't mean that it has to be toony but it should be beautiful and pleasant to the eye on every single frame.
lol you even have to import that thing, god that is creepy, perfect for a heist or robbery.
no, not better, its perfect!

I'm happy with only using a simple gnu text editor... most (all?) IDEs are bloatware.
it can be fun, but it can also be hell, usually "I found myself within a forest dark" whenever i have to use a package manager (which i don't for most languages).

@Styromaniac: i don't have good coding "standards" (meaning none at all) to benefit anyone lol. i did non-profit for 3D animation many years ago, lets just say that it didn't work well as it was my first official project.

but you are right in that it is a puzzle and you will get better provided you keep going, but pressure can really break you, specially if you don't keep your expectations in check.
@GomZik: vscode is fine... but it uses a lot of memory, each plugin you install adds a considerable loading time and memory usage, its fine until you wish to customize it too.
shadows? where? honestly, i can't see it.
@Styromaniac: lol i'm confused, the one on the video thumbnail?
@Styromaniac: oh right, it looks good imo.
@GomZik: it does that by delaying plugin loading... on many occasions i had to wait several seconds just to use a plugin feature.
@Styromaniac: but now i have two scrollbars, oh yeah forgot to mention, i had a vertical scrollbar and now i have a horizontal too, doesn't matter how big or small the browser window is.

@Styromaniac: firefox, yes i had this issue, you can use something like [this](http://tysonmatanich.github.io/viewportSize/) which uses js... there is another way to do this with css but i can't find it anywhere.

@Styromaniac: u ok? its really hard to deal with anything while not feeling well i guess, looking back, being angry was always the wrong choice, it didn't solve anything most of the time.
The usual suspects, Get out, The Man from Earth (kinda of) can't think of any other.
@Styromaniac: yeah its an awesome movie but its not worth watching very often, maybe a decade later or so.
@Styromaniac: definitely, didn't know it flopped.
still, you probably don't wanna have multiple video players, it just waste resources.

@Styromaniac: i didn't do any debugging to check how much resources (cpu time, memory, latency, etc.) using n+1 number of video-player objects consume. it may very well be free real-state but its rarely a good idea to just create a new object (video-player) that are composed of many objects (idk how many but its a far cry from a simple primitive type, whatever that means in the web browser context) as many times as possible. its always better to reuse a simple resource if possible, and i think this is exactly such a case where you would only want one resource (video-player) to be shared.
